mcq.q: What is the primary definition of Computer Graphics?
opts: Generating, manipulating, and displaying visual content using computers
mcq.answer: Generating, manipulating, and displaying visual content using computers

mcq.q: Which of these is NOT mentioned as an application of Computer Graphics?
What is the correct sequence of the primary stages in the Graphics Pipeline?
Which coordinate system comes after 'World Coordinates' in the graphics pipeline?
What are the two main types of Computer Graphics?
What are the three components of a modern graphics display system?
opts: Display controller, Digital memory, Television monitor
mcq.answer: Display controller, Digital memory, Television monitor

mcq.q: What is the function of the Display Controller?
opts: Pass Frame Buffer's contents to the monitor
mcq.answer: Pass Frame Buffer's contents to the monitor

mcq.q: What is another name for the Digital Memory in graphics systems?
How are images stored in a Frame Buffer?
What is the modern term for Frame Buffer?
Why does the Frame Buffer help increase graphics speed?
opts: It eliminates the need for a graphics card
Graphics hardware can quickly read/write without involving slower main CPU
It reduces the monitor's refresh rate
mcq.answer: Graphics hardware can quickly read/write without involving slower main CPU

tf.q: Computer graphics deals only with simple 2D images.
Medical imaging uses computer graphics for 3D reconstructions of CT scans.
Rasterization is the process of converting 3D information into a 2D image.
In interactive computer graphics, users have no control over the image.
The display controller is also known as a display card.
VGA card typically has a resolution of 1920x1080.
In frame buffer, 0 represents darkness and 1 represents image or picture.
Non-interactive graphics are completely controlled by program instructions.
Drawing on touch screens is an example of interactive computer graphics.
The television monitor is responsible for executing graphics calculations.

mcq.answer: They work with different screen resolutions

tf.q: Rasterization is the process of converting 3D models into vector graphics.
Vector graphics can be scaled infinitely without losing quality.
Real-time rendering is commonly used in film production.
Raster images are resolution-dependent.
The frame buffer is located in the CPU processor.
Vector files are typically larger than high-resolution raster images.
Rasterization is often used in real-time rendering for video games.
Offline rendering prioritizes speed over quality.
Each pixel in a raster image has a defined color value.
Vector graphics are made up of a grid of colored squares.
The frame buffer acts as temporary storage for pixel data.
Raster images are best suited for logos and simple illustrations.

opts: It doesn't work for straight lines

mcq.q: Why is the Slope-Intercept method not suitable for computer graphics?
opts: It only works for curved lines

tf.q: A point in three-dimensional space is represented as (x₁, y₁).
Two points would represent a line or edge.
In computer graphics, lines are drawn as continuous perfect lines.
The slope of a straight line is always constant.
In the equation y = 3x - 2, the y-intercept is 3.
For parallel lines, the slopes are equal.
The Slope-Intercept method is the fastest method for line drawing in computer graphics.
Parametric form uses a parameter 't' that varies between 0 and 1.
In parametric form, when t=0.5, you get the midpoint of the line.
The main problem with both Slope-Intercept and Parametric forms is the use of floating-point numbers.
Pixels are the tiny squares that make up a computer screen.
The y-intercept is where the line crosses the x-axis.
For points (1,-7) and (3,-15), the slope is -4.

mcq.q: What is the main disadvantage of the DDA algorithm mentioned?
opts: It only works for vertical lines

mcq.q: What is one advantage of the DDA algorithm?
For endpoints (23,33) and (29,40), what is the value of Δx?
For endpoints (23,33) and (29,40), what is the value of Δy?
In the DDA example with points (23,33) and (29,40), what is the length used?
What is the x-increment for points (23,33) and (29,40)?
What is the y-increment for points (23,33) and (29,40)?
For the line from (0,0) to (6,6), what are the x and y increments?
For the line from (0,0) to (4,6), what is the x-increment?
For the line from (0,0) to (4,6), what is the y-increment?

opts: It only works for short lines

mcq.q: How many iterations are needed for the line from (0,0) to (6,6)?
In DDA, when m<1, what is the increment strategy?

tf.q: DDA algorithm completely eliminates floating point arithmetic.
The DDA algorithm is simpler to implement than the slope-intercept method.
For endpoints (23,33) and (29,40), the first plotted point is (23,33).
In DDA, the number of steps equals the minimum of Δx and Δy.
The line from (0,0) to (6,6) has equal x and y increments.
For the line from (0,0) to (4,6), the length used is 4.
DDA algorithm provides perfect end point accuracy.
In the line from (0,0) to (4,6), when x=2.66, y=4.
For m=1 in DDA, both x and y are incremented by 1.
The DDA algorithm is faster than using the direct equation y=mx+b.

mcq.q: What is the basic principle of Bresenham's line algorithm?
opts: To use floating point calculations for accuracy
To select optimum raster locations to represent a straight line
To draw lines using only trigonometric functions
To work only with horizontal and vertical lines
mcq.answer: To select optimum raster locations to represent a straight line

mcq.q: What type of calculations does Bresenham's algorithm use?
For lines with slope |m| < 1, what coordinate is always incremented by one?
What is the initial decision parameter p₀ in Bresenham's algorithm?
If pₖ < 0, what is the next point to plot?
If pₖ ≥ 0, what is the next point to plot?
For endpoints (20,10) and (30,18), what is the value of Δx?
For endpoints (20,10) and (30,18), what is the value of Δy?
For endpoints (20,10) and (30,18), what is the initial decision parameter p₀?
When pₖ < 0, how is pₖ₊₁ calculated?
When pₖ ≥ 0, how is pₖ₊₁ calculated?
For which slopes does Bresenham's algorithm NOT need to be used?
In which octant is a line with slope between 0 and 1?
What is the main advantage of Bresenham's algorithm over DDA?
opts: It works only for special cases
It is slower but more accurate

mcq.q: For endpoints (5,8) and (9,11), what is the initial decision parameter?

tf.q: Bresenham's algorithm uses floating point arithmetic extensively.
The algorithm always increments both x and y coordinates by one.
For lines with |m| < 1, x is always incremented by one.
The decision parameter determines whether to increment y or not.
Bresenham's algorithm works only for lines in the first octant.
When pₖ < 0, the next point is (xₖ₊₁, yₖ) and pₖ₊₁ = pₖ + 2Δy.
When pₖ ≥ 0, the next point is (xₖ₊₁, yₖ₊₁) and pₖ₊₁ = pₖ + 2Δy - 2Δx.
For horizontal lines, Bresenham's algorithm is not needed.
The number of iterations in Bresenham's algorithm is Δx - 1.
Bresenham's algorithm is less efficient than the DDA algorithm.
For endpoints (20,10) and (30,18), the first point plotted is (20,10).
The algorithm can handle lines in all eight octants.
Bresenham's algorithm was developed specifically for circle drawing only.
In the second octant, the roles of x and y are swapped.
The decision parameter pₖ is always positive.

mcq.q: A line has endpoints (48,8) and (32,3). In which octant is this line located?
A line has endpoints (3,48) and (8,32). In which octant is this line located?
A line has endpoints (32,3) and (48,8). In which octant is this line located?
A line has endpoints (8,48) and (3,32). In which octant is this line located?
A line has endpoints (48,3) and (32,8). In which octant is this line located?
A line has endpoints (32,8) and (48,3). In which octant is this line located?
A line has endpoints (3,32) and (8,48). In which octant is this line located?
A line has endpoints (8,32) and (3,48). In which octant is this line located?
In the First Octant, what operations are performed?
In the Second Octant, what is the main operation before plotting?
opts: INC both X and Y by -1

mcq.q: Which octant requires swapping coordinates AND decrementing both X and Y?
In the Fourth Octant, what operation is performed on X?
Which octant uses 'INC Y by -1, set_pixel(X,Y)'?
In the Seventh Octant, what operations are performed?
opts: Swap X1,Y1 and Swap X2,Y2, INC X by -1, set_pixel(Y,X)
INC Y by -1, INC X by -1, set_pixel(X,Y)
Swap X1,Y1 and Swap X2,Y2, INC Y by -1, set_pixel(Y,X)
mcq.answer: Swap X1,Y1 and Swap X2,Y2, INC X by -1, set_pixel(Y,X)

mcq.q: Which octant requires only decrementing X before plotting?
In the Fifth Octant, what operations are performed?
opts: INC X by -1, INC Y by -1, set_pixel(X,Y)
Swap X1,Y1 and Swap X2,Y2, set_pixel(Y,X)
mcq.answer: INC X by -1, INC Y by -1, set_pixel(X,Y)

When Pₖ < 0, how is Pₖ₊₁ calculated?
When Pₖ ≥ 0, how is Pₖ₊₁ calculated?
The Midpoint Circle Algorithm terminates when:
Which mathematician developed the Midpoint Circle Algorithm?

opts: To determine if a point is inside/on/outside circle
mcq.answer: To determine if a point is inside/on/outside circle

mcq.q: For the point (4,9) in octant-1, what is the corresponding point in octant-2?
What is evaluated at the midpoint between candidate pixels?

tf.q: The simple circle drawing algorithm using y = ±√(r² - x²) is very efficient for computer graphics.
The Midpoint Circle Algorithm uses eight-way symmetry to reduce calculations.
In the Midpoint Circle Algorithm, we calculate all points of the circle directly.
The initial point for a circle centered at (0,0) with radius r is (0,r).
When Pₖ < 0, the midpoint is outside the circle.
When Pₖ ≥ 0, the midpoint is inside or on the circle.
The algorithm moves in unit steps along the x-axis.
For a circle with radius 10, the initial decision parameter P₀ is -10.
Points in other octants are obtained by swapping and negating coordinates.
The Midpoint Circle Algorithm uses floating point arithmetic extensively.
The circle function f_circ(x,y) = x² + y² - r² equals 0 for points on the circle.
The algorithm continues until x becomes less than y.
For radius 10, the point (7,7) is the last point calculated in the first octant.
The Midpoint Circle Algorithm can only draw circles centered at (0,0).
The algorithm uses only integer arithmetic for efficiency.
